questions.text: A 48-year-old man presents with severe chest pain and is diagnosed with an acute myocardial infarction. Laboratory tests reveal elevated troponin levels, and an echocardiogram shows decreased ejection fraction. A biopsy of the affected myocardium reveals cell swelling, disruption of cellular membranes, and the release of intracellular contents into the surrounding tissue. Which of the following findings most specifically indicates necrosis rather than apoptosis?

options.label: B
options.text: Cell shrinkage with intact cell membrane

questions.correct_answer: C. Inflammatory response in surrounding tissue
questions.explanation:
Ans. C)

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Necrosis , unlike apoptosis, is characterized by the loss of cell membrane integrity and the release of intracellular contents , leading to an inflammatory response in surrounding tissue . This is a key distinguishing feature of necrosis.
  • ➤ Necrosis
  • ➤ loss of cell membrane integrity
  • ➤ release of intracellular contents
  • ➤ inflammatory response in surrounding tissue

questions.text: A 3-year-old boy is brought to the clinic by his parents due to recurrent ear infections, chronic diarrhea, and eczema. On examination, he has small bruises and petechiae on his skin. Laboratory findings reveal a low platelet count and normal levels of white blood cells and red blood cells. Which of the following is the likely additional finding in this patient?

options.label: A
options.text: Family history of a maternal uncle who died at a young age due to a bleeding disorder

options.label: B
options.text: Family history of females affected more than males

options.label: C
options.text: Family history of disease exclusively transmitted from mother to all her progeny

options.label: D
options.text: Family history of at least 1 member in every previous generation affected irrespective of sex

questions.correct_answer: A. Family history of a maternal uncle who died at a young age due to a bleeding disorder
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Family history of a maternal uncle who died at a young age due to a bleeding disorder

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Wiskott-Aldrich syndrome is an X-linked recessive disorder characterized by recurrent infections , thrombocytopenia , and eczema , with a family history that typically involves male relatives , such as a maternal uncle, who may have died young due to a bleeding disorder.
  • ➤ Wiskott-Aldrich syndrome
  • ➤ X-linked recessive
  • ➤ recurrent infections
  • ➤ thrombocytopenia
  • ➤ eczema
  • ➤ male relatives

questions.text: Which of the following is correctly matched?

  • ➤ Hodgkin lymphoma
  • ➤ painless cervical lymphadenopathy
  • ➤ Diffuse large B cell lymphoma often presents as a rapid-growing mass at the Waldeyer ring .
  • ➤ Diffuse large B cell lymphoma
  • ➤ rapid-growing mass at the Waldeyer ring
  • ➤ Burkitt lymphoma presents as a rapidly growing mass affecting the mandible .
  • ➤ Burkitt lymphoma
  • ➤ rapidly growing mass affecting the mandible
  • ➤ Mantle cell lymphoma is associated with GI polyps .
  • ➤ Mantle cell lymphoma
  • ➤ GI polyps

questions.text: Which of the following kidney disorders is associated with a mutation in the COL4A5 chain?

options.label: A
options.text: A 45-year-old male presents with hematuria, proteinuria, and hearing loss

options.label: B
options.text: A 30-year-old female complains of shortness of breath and cough, and chest X-ray reveals pulmonary hemorrhage

options.label: C
options.text: A 25-year-old female undergoes renal biopsy showing thinning of glomerular basement membrane

options.label: D
options.text: A 50-year-old male presents with nephrotic syndrome and renal biopsy reveals nodular lesions in glomeruli.

Ans. A) A 45-year-old male presents with hematuria, proteinuria, and hearing loss

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Alport syndrome is associated with a mutation in the COL4A5 gene and presents with hematuria, proteinuria, and sensorineural hearing loss.

questions.text: A 16-year-old female presents with recurrent abdominal pain and melena. Physical examination reveals multiple pigmented macules on her lips, buccal mucosa, and fingers. An upper endoscopy reveals multiple hamartomatous polyps in the stomach and small intestine. The genetic testing confirms a mutation in the STK11 gene. Which of the following complications is she at greatest risk for?
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Intussusception

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Peutz-Jeghers syndrome (PJS) is associated with hamartomatous polyps and an increased risk of intussusception in young patients.

questions.text: Which of the following conditions does not show the graph as depicted by the red line: Sickle cell anemia Autoimmune hemolytic anemia Hereditary spherocytosis Thalassemia
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) 1 and 4

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Conditions like hereditary spherocytosis and autoimmune hemolytic anemia show increased osmotic fragility, while sickle cell anemia and thalassemia do not demonstrate the same fragility pattern.

questions.text: A 30-year-old man with progressive exertional dyspnea is found to have elevated liver enzymes. A liver biopsy is performed and light microscopy of the tissue specimen after periodic acid-Schiff staining is shown in the image. Which of the following is the most likely cause of this patient's dyspnea?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Inter-alveolar septa destruction

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ α1-antitrypsin deficiency (AATD) leads to inter-alveolar septa destruction, causing panacinar emphysema and liver enzyme elevation due to protein accumulation.

questions.text: A 61-year-old woman consults a doctor due to persistent malaise for five years and presents with high blood pressure. She passes away unexpectedly within a week. The autopsy reveals her kidneys' external and bisected appearance, as shown in images. Which of the following is not expected to be seen in this patent?

options.label: B
options.text: A utosomal dominant with low penetrance

questions.correct_answer: B. A utosomal dominant with low penetrance
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Autosomal dominant with low penetrance

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Autosomal Dominant Polycystic Kidney Disease (ADPKD) is a high-penetrance genetic disorder associated with multiple cysts in the kidneys, hypertension, colonic diverticula, an increased risk of subarachnoid hemorrhage from berry aneurysms, and mitral valve prolapse.

questions.text: A man with a renal disease presents to the clinic with worsening fatigue and muscle weakness. Further studies reveal increased lipid peroxidation products and decreased glutathione levels in his blood. Which of the following mechanisms is most likely contributing to his ongoing cellular injury?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Ferroptosis

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Ferroptosis is an iron-dependent, programmed cell death mechanism characterized by increased lipid peroxidation and reduced glutathione levels, leading to oxidative stress and cell damage.

questions.text: A 40-year-old woman presents with endometrial carcinoma. Her mother died of endometrial cancer at age 50, and her 42-year-old brother was recently diagnosed with colon cancer. You suspect a familial cancer syndrome. Which gene in this family is most likely to be mutated?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) MSH2

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Lynch syndrome (HNPCC) is associated with mutations in mismatch repair genes (MSH2, MLH1) and significantly increases the risk of colon, endometrial, and ovarian cancers.

questions.text: A 52-year-old woman presents with a palpable lump in her left breast with bloody nipple discharge. A core needle biopsy is performed, and histopathology reveals sheets of small, pleomorphic cells infiltrating the stroma with the formation of glandular structures. Which of the following is not true for her?

options.label: A
options.text: Diamino benzidine is used for brown color in IHC.

options.label: B
options.text: For a score 2 in IHC, Fluorescence in situ hybridization is indicated.

options.label: C
options.text: Under activity of CDH1 gene tends to be bilateral and multifocal.

options.label: D
options.text: Over expression of E cadherin has association with familial gastric cancer.

questions.correct_answer: D. Over expression of E cadherin has association with familial gastric cancer.
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Overexpression of E-cadherin has an association with familial gastric cancer

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Loss of E-cadherin expression, rather than overexpression, is associated with familial gastric cancer and certain breast cancer subtypes, such as lobular carcinoma.

questions.text: Pick the incorrect statements about hemolytic anemia Sickle cell anemia has high osmotic fragility and high mechanical fragility Increased HbA2 is seen with iron deficiency anemia Mentzer index helps in differentiation of thalassemia trait from iron deficiency anemia Donath Landsteiner antibody is seen in cold hemolysin disease
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) 1 and 2

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Sickle cell anemia does not have high osmotic fragility. Increased HbA2 is associated with beta-thalassemia, not iron deficiency anemia. The Mentzer index is a useful tool to differentiate thalassemia trait from iron deficiency anemia. Donath-Landsteiner antibody is a key finding in paroxysmal cold hemoglobinuria (cold hemolysin disease).
  • ➤ Sickle cell anemia does not have high osmotic fragility. Increased HbA2 is associated with beta-thalassemia, not iron deficiency anemia.
  • ➤ The Mentzer index is a useful tool to differentiate thalassemia trait from iron deficiency anemia.
  • ➤ Donath-Landsteiner antibody is a key finding in paroxysmal cold hemoglobinuria (cold hemolysin disease).

questions.text: A 60-year-old female with a history of von Hippel-Lindau (VHL) disease presents with abdominal discomfort and elevated blood pressure. Pick the true statements about her condition She may have a mutation in the short arm of chromosome 3 High risk of papillary carcinoma of the kidney Histology shows cells with perinuclear halo Cells have high glycogen and fat inside them
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Only 1 and 4

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Von Hippel-Lindau (VHL) disease is associated with mutations on chromosome 3, leading to a high risk of clear cell renal carcinoma characterized by cells with high glycogen and lipid content.

questions.text: A 60-year-old male presents with an enlarging mass in his left thigh. A biopsy of the mass reveals pleomorphic spindle-shaped cells with high nuclear-to-cytoplasmic ratios, frequent mitotic figures, and areas of necrosis. IHC staining is positive for vimentin and negative for cytokeratin. The tumor cells demonstrate overexpression of matrix metalloproteinases (MMPs). Which of the following characteristics is most closely associated with the behavior of this tumor?

options.label: C
options.text: Invasion of the basement membrane and metastasis

options.label: D
options.text: Cellular senescence due to telomere shortening

questions.correct_answer: C. Invasion of the basement membrane and metastasis
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Invasion of the basement membrane and metastasis

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Overexpression of matrix metalloproteinases (MMPs) is associated with increased invasion of the basement membrane and metastasis, which contributes to the aggressive nature of sarcomas.

questions.text: Which of the following is not correct?

options.label: A
options.text: FISH is useful for chromosomal anomalies (like deletion, amplification, and translocation)

options.label: B
options.text: Single base primer extension is done for detection of point mutation

options.label: C
options.text: Array-based comparative genomic hybridization cannot be used if deletion is unknown detect deletion/amplification

options.label: D
options.text: Real-time PCR performed on cDNA is the method of choice for monitoring residual disease in CML

questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Array-based comparative genomic hybridization cannot be used if deletion is unknown detect deletion/amplification

  • ➤ Array-based comparative genomic hybridization (aCGH) can be used to detect unknown deletions and amplifications across the genome. Therefore, statement C is incorrect.

questions.text: Which of the following is correctly matched?

options.label: C
options.text: Saline washed red cells: increased risk of allergic reactions

questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Cryo poor plasma: TTP

  • ➤ TTP

questions.text: A 58-year-old male presents with vague abdominal discomfort and early satiety. A CT scan of the abdomen reveals a 6 cm mass in the stomach. Endoscopic biopsy shows spindle-shaped cells with positive immunohistochemical staining for CD117 and DOG1. Which of the following is not a marker for gastrointestinal stromal tumor?
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) NRG-1

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ KIT (CD117), PDGFR, and SDH are common markers associated with gastrointestinal stromal tumors (GISTs) . NRG-1 is not a marker for GIST.
  • ➤ KIT (CD117), PDGFR, and SDH
  • ➤ gastrointestinal stromal tumors (GISTs)
  • ➤ NRG-1

questions.text: Physical examination of a 23 year old man diagnosed with chronic hepatitis shows corneal changes that are visible to the naked eye, as shown in the image. This patient is most likely to have which of the following conditions?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Basal ganglia atrophy

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Wilson's disease is caused by a mutation in the ATP7B gene , which leads to copper accumulation in the liver, brain (especially the basal ganglia), cornea (Kayser-Fleischer rings), and kidneys.
  • ➤ ATP7B gene

questions.text: A 25-year-old woman presents with a history of heavy menstrual bleeding, easy bruising, and prolonged bleeding after dental procedures. Platelet aggregation testing shows abnormal aggregation in the presence of ristocetin, but normal aggregation with ADP and collagen. Which of the following is the most appropriate statement for her condition?

options.label: C

Ans. C) Mild bleeding is associated with type III subtype

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In von Willebrand Disease, Type III is typically severe but may present with mild bleeding in certain atypical cases.

questions.text: Which of the following is an incorrect statement about the condition having cells as shown with an inflammatory background? The cells are of B cell origin and have CD30 + and PAX 5 + Commonest site affected is the Waldeyer ring Nodular sclerosis variant commonly involves the mediastinum Lymphocyte predominant variant has poor prognosis

questions.text: "Moldy" grains in some low socio economic area populated areas contain a substance that causes a specific G-to-T mutation in gene p53. The population in these regions is expected to be at an increased risk of which of the following diseases?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Liver cancer

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Aflatoxins , produced by molds found in poorly stored grains, are known to cause a specific G-to-T mutation in the p53 gene , increasing the risk of hepatocellular carcinoma (liver cancer) .

  • ➤ p53 gene
  • ➤ hepatocellular carcinoma (liver cancer)

questions.text: Which of the following symptoms is least likely to be observed in a patient diagnosed with the flow cytometry pattern as shown in the image.

questions.text: A 60-year-old man suffering from persistent fatigue and lymph node enlargement visits the outpatient department. Examination of his peripheral smear reveals the image as shown. Pick the incorrect option.

options.label: A
options.text: Arises commonly from a Naïve B cell

options.label: C
options.text: Tumor cells have high-level expression of BCL2

options.label: D
options.text: Investigation of choice to confirm the diagnosis is flow cytometry

questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Commonest cytogenetic mutation is 13p deletion

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ CLL is a malignancy of naïve B cells that frequently presents in older adults. The most common cytogenetic abnormality is 13q deletion , and BCL2 overexpression is a hallmark of CLL. Flow cytometry is the investigation of choice for confirming the diagnosis of CLL.
  • ➤ CLL is a malignancy of naïve B cells that frequently presents in older adults.
  • ➤ CLL
  • ➤ naïve B cells
  • ➤ The most common cytogenetic abnormality is 13q deletion , and BCL2 overexpression is a hallmark of CLL.
  • ➤ 13q deletion
  • ➤ BCL2
  • ➤ Flow cytometry is the investigation of choice for confirming the diagnosis of CLL.

questions.text: Which of the following is not correctly matched?

options.label: B

options.label: C

questions.text: A 30-year-old male with anorexia and fatigue is found to have persistently elevated serum alanine aminotransferase (ALT) and aspartate aminotransferase (AST) levels. He is also positive for HBsAg. Which of the following best describes the mechanism of liver injury in this patient?

options.label: A
options.text: Viral cytotoxic effect and hepatocyte necrosis with following secondary inflammation

options.label: B

options.label: C
options.text: Circulating viral antigen-antibody complexes with small vessel deposition and immunologic vessel injury

Ans. D) CD8+ T lymphocyte response to viral antigens on the cell surface resulting in hepatocyte damage

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ CD8+ T cells play a crucial role in the immune response to hepatitis B virus , leading to hepatocyte damage and liver inflammation. This immune response is responsible for the elevated liver enzymes seen in infected patients.

questions.text: A 34-year-old female comes to your office for evaluation of infertility. She reveals that her menstrual periods occur 2-3 times per year. Physical examination reveals moderate obesity and excessive facial hair growth. This patient is at increased risk for which of the following conditions:
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Endometrial adenocarcinoma

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Women with polycystic ovarian syndrome (PCOS) are at increased risk of endometrial adenocarcinoma due to prolonged unopposed estrogen stimulation. PCOS also increases the risk for type 2 diabetes due to insulin resistance , but not type 1 diabetes.
  • ➤ polycystic ovarian syndrome (PCOS)
  • ➤ endometrial adenocarcinoma
  • ➤ type 2 diabetes
  • ➤ insulin resistance

questions.text: A 56-year-old female with a 1-week history of dysuria and flank pain develops chills, high fever, and confusion. Her blood pressure is 80/40 mm Hg and her heart rate is 120/min. questions.explanation:
Ans. D) TNF-α

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ TNF-α is a critical mediator of the systemic inflammatory response in sepsis, leading to fever , hypotension , and shock . Its overproduction is responsible for the hemodynamic instability seen in septic shock.

  • ➤ hypotension
  • ➤ shock

questions.text: A 35-year-old woman comes to the clinic due to severe heartburn that is resistant to over-the-counter antacids. questions.text: A 6-year-old boy of Punjabi descent presents with fatigue and pallor. His physical examination is unremarkable. questions.text: A 5-month-old boy is being evaluated for poor weight gain since birth. He is noted to have bulky and greasy stools. A jejunal biopsy shows the findings seen in the image. This patient most likely suffers from which of the following conditions?

Thromboelastography (TEG) results show a prolonged R-time, a normal alpha angle, a normal maximum amplitude, and a normal lysis index. Which of the following therapies is most appropriate based on these TEG findings?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Fresh frozen plasma
